page.title: 12MOAT FARM
page.content: MOAT FARM (CONT PAGE 11) To maximize the output from the farm Mr. Keene uses fertilizers and pesticides. These are very expensive, a 750 Kg bag of fertilizer costs Â£75. They are in a powder form and are applied to the crops by spray from a tractor. They have to careful when they do spray the crops so that the powder is not washed away by the rain to pollute the streams. The farm loses some of its crop to small animals, rabbits, rats, mice and birds but no special precautions are taken against these pests. The main crop at Moat Farm is barley which is sold to a local farming co-operative for animal feed. The farm does have 200 acres set aside for horticulture and a few acres for gooseberries and blackcurrants.
